definition: silence/solemnly silent/peaceful/to pacify
respectful/solemn/to eliminate/to clean up
surname Su
still/calm/quiet/not moving

sentences.english: Hush now baby , it's time to go to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 肅靜現在寶貝，它是該去睡覺的時候。

sentences.english: 'Not Guilty'was the verdict that thrilled through the breathless court.
sentences.chinese: “無罪”的裁決震徹了整個肅靜的法庭。

sentences.english: Then the first blast went off, and the grim quiet erupted into pandemonium.
sentences.chinese: 接着第一聲爆炸響起，肅靜瞬間變成一片混亂。

sentences.english: The Ambassador's witty opening remarks soon broke the silence.
sentences.chinese: 但劉大使的風趣開場白很快打破了現場的肅靜。

sentences.english: Timid men prefer the calm of despotism to the boisterous sea of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 懦夫寧要專制之下的肅靜，不要自由之上的喧囂。

sentences.english: They hushed as the judge walked in .
sentences.chinese: 法官走進來時，他們肅靜了下來。

sentences.english: The house stood in hushed silence.
sentences.chinese: 全場的觀衆都肅靜無聲地站着。

sentences.english: made its way slowly through the silent streets.
sentences.chinese: 送葬的隊伍緩緩地穿過肅靜的街道。

sentences.english: He shouted in defiance of the policeman's warning to be quiet.
sentences.chinese: 他大聲叫喊，違抗這警察要求肅靜的警告。

definition: lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
sullen/to scowl miserably
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
to force someone to do something
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
knell
red in the face/extremely angry
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
chance and opportunity
to be reluctant to give up a post
